intro: Retama recutita, commonly known as Spanish broom, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it adaptable to arid environments. Retama recutita is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which enhances soil fertility.
